Body:
When you compare English with e.g .Russian or some other Slavic language, English sounds very cold and not warming at all. Could it be explained scientifically?

Compare this in Russian:

http://youtu.be/MKGH2tmrp08?t=9m22s

And this in English:

http://youtu.be/LgaakhgbL9s?t=3m15s

Russian to me sounds more "human" and warm. Could it be scientifically explain?
Title: Why does English sound so cold to a Slavic speaker?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.
